content.question: A manufacturer of cell phone screens is concerned because 12 percent of the screens manufactured using a previous process were rejected at the final inspection and could not be sold. A new process is introduced that is intended to reduce the proportion of rejected screens. After the process has been in place for several months a random sample of 100 screens is selected and inspected. Of the 100 screens 6 are rejected. What are the appropriate hypotheses to investigate whether the new process reduces the population proportion of screens that will be rejected?

choices.label: <math alttext="H sub 0: p equals 0.12; H sub a: p is less than 0.12" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtable><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><mrow><mi>p</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0.12</mn></mrow></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>a</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><mrow><mi>p</mi><mo><</mo><mn>0.12</mn></mrow></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></math>

<math alttext="H sub 0: p equals 0.12; H sub a: p is greater than 0.12" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtable><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><mrow><mi>p</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0.12</mn></mrow></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>a</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><mrow><mi>p</mi><mo>></mo><mn>0.12</mn></mrow></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></math>

<math alttext="H sub 0: p equals 0.06; H sub a: p is less than 0.06" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtable><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><mrow><mi>p</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0.06</mn></mrow></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>a</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><mrow><mi>p</mi><mo><</mo><mn>0.06</mn></mrow></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="H sub 0: p hat equals 0.06; H sub a : p hat is greater than 0.06" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtable><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><mrow><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>^</mo></mrow></mover><mo>=</mo><mn>0.06</mn></mrow></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>a</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><mrow><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>^</mo></mrow></mover><mo>></mo><mn>0.06</mn></mrow></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></math>

<math alttext="H sub 0: p hat equals 0.12; H sub a: p hat is less than 0.12" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtable><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><mrow><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>^</mo></mrow></mover><mo>=</mo><mn>0.12</mn></mrow></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>a</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><mrow><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>^</mo></mrow></mover><mo><</mo><mn>0.12</mn></mrow></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></math>

topic.text: 6.4: Setting Up a Test for a Population Proportion

skill.text: Skill 1.F: Identify null and alternative hypotheses.
